meanings.definition: (verb) To become red in the face from embarrassment or exertion.
meanings.sent1: After tripping in front of everyone, she started to blowse with embarrassment.
meanings.sent2: When he was caught cheating, his face began to blowse in shame.
meanings.sent3: The magician's failed trick made the audience blowse with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in hues that made it seem to blowse with color.
meanings.sent5: The spicy food made her blowse, adding a rosy tint to her cheeks.

meanings.definition: (adjective) Having a red or flushed complexion.
meanings.sent1: The blowse cheeks of the child showed he had been playing outside all day.
meanings.sent2: The blowse face of the hiker indicated he had been under the sun for hours.
meanings.sent3: The blowse flowers in the garden added a vibrant touch to the landscape.
meanings.sent4: The blowse sky at sunset made the whole scene look magical.
meanings.sent5: Her blowse complexion made her look healthy and full of life.

meanings.definition: (noun) A woman with a red or flushed complexion.
meanings.sent1: The blowse walked gracefully down the runway, captivating everyone with her beauty.
meanings.sent2: The blowse in the painting had a serene expression, as if lost in thought.
meanings.sent3: The blowse at the party wore a stunning red dress that complemented her complexion.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the village blowse, with her radiant smile and warm personality.
meanings.sent5: The blowse's laughter echoed through the room, filling it with joy.
